snippet.textDisplay: I feel CS pak makes likeable music which majority of the newer generation will appreciate. But in the case of CS Ind it seems like the musicians & the composers are given a licence to experiment & play around with different styles by not restricting them. Hence, the difference.
snippet.textOriginal: I feel CS pak makes likeable music which majority of the newer generation will appreciate. But in the case of CS Ind it seems like the musicians & the composers are given a licence to experiment & play around with different styles by not restricting them. Hence, the difference.

snippet.textOriginal: And as I could'nt add to the previous post due to character limitations, Kudos to Amit for such a beautiful composition!!! Take a bow!!! Performance of the CS India team is needless to say simply amazing/spot-on/ebullient/professional....Great singing Milli! And Shriram, well what can I say...U were the dynamite in this piece :)

snippet.textDisplay: Some people complain about the 1)Over-arranged nature & 2) Lack of  rawness, serenity, sufi-ness of CS India as compared to that of Pakistan. As a musician myself, I feel differently on both these aspects.1) Arrangement is always subjective, but the one purpose should be to enrich the composition. 2) In India we have so many genres of classical+folk music itself that the kind of possibilities we have is simply mind boggling (ex: Shriram's part is gorgeous!)..This song does justice on both counts
snippet.textOriginal: Some people complain about the 1)Over-arranged nature & 2) Lack of  rawness, serenity, sufi-ness of CS India as compared to that of Pakistan. As a musician myself, I feel differently on both these aspects.1) Arrangement is always subjective, but the one purpose should be to enrich the composition. 2) In India we have so many genres of classical+folk music itself that the kind of possibilities we have is simply mind boggling (ex: Shriram's part is gorgeous!)..This song does justice on both counts

snippet.textDisplay: I see no matter how much efforts we make, CS Pak is still far ahead and beyond.....we lack something which they have - something quite magical....just beats me what that stuff is....although we are also equally if not more talented than them...let me know what that differentiating factor is......I think it is something very serene, very sufi about their music, no matter what genre they are playing...
snippet.textOriginal: I see no matter how much efforts we make, CS Pak is still far ahead and beyond.....we lack something which they have - something quite magical....just beats me what that stuff is....although we are also equally if not more talented than them...let me know what that differentiating factor is......I think it is something very serene, very sufi about their music, no matter what genre they are playing...

snippet.textDisplay: Shriram bhai, every time I hear this... its just mind boggling. What a composition, arrangement.... voice, both Mili Nair and you! The entire rhythm section, and little stylish fillers by Sanjoy Das! Its almost like last 20 times I have heard this song, I find something new and beautiful. God bless Amit Trivedi, and all of you to have taken us such a journey (Yatra)! Amazing is an understatement.
snippet.textOriginal: Shriram bhai, every time I hear this... its just mind boggling. What a composition, arrangement.... voice, both Mili Nair and you! The entire rhythm section, and little stylish fillers by Sanjoy Das! Its almost like last 20 times I have heard this song, I find something new and beautiful. God bless Amit Trivedi, and all of you to have taken us such a journey (Yatra)! Amazing is an understatement.
